013package org.apache.juneau.examples.core.json;
014
015import java.util.*;
016
017import org.apache.juneau.examples.core.pojo.*;
018import org.apache.juneau.json.*;
019
020/**
021 * Sample class which shows the complex usage of JsonSerializer and JsonParser.
022 *
023 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
024 * </ul>
025 */
026public class JsonComplexExample {
027
028   /**
029    * Serializing PojoComplex bean into Json type
030    * and Deserialize back to PojoComplex instance type.
031    *
032    * @param args Unused.
033    * @throws Exception Unused.
034    */
035   public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception{
036      // Juneau provides static constants with the most commonly used configurations
037      // Get a reference to a serializer - converting POJO to flat format
038      /**
039       * Produces
040       * {"innerPojo":{"name":"name0","id":"1.0"},
041       * "values":{"setOne":[{"name":"name1","id":"1.1"},{"name":"name2","id":"1.1"}],
042       * "setTwo":[{"name":"name1","id":"1.2"},{"name":"name2","id":"1.2"}]},"id":"pojo"}
043       */
044      JsonSerializer jsonSerializer = JsonSerializer.DEFAULT;
045      // Get a reference to a parser - converts that flat format back into the POJO
046      JsonParser jsonParser = JsonParser.DEFAULT;
047
048      // Fill some data to a PojoComplex bean
049      HashMap<String, List<Pojo>> values = new HashMap<>();
050      ArrayList<Pojo> setOne = new ArrayList<>();
051      setOne.add(new Pojo("1.1", "name1"));
052      setOne.add(new Pojo("1.1", "name2"));
053      ArrayList<Pojo> setTwo = new ArrayList<>();
054      setTwo.add(new Pojo("1.2", "name1"));
055      setTwo.add(new Pojo("1.2", "name2"));
056      values.put("setOne", setOne);
057      values.put("setTwo", setTwo);
058      PojoComplex pojoc = new PojoComplex("pojo", new Pojo("1.0", "name0"), values);
059
060      String flat = jsonSerializer.serialize(pojoc);
061
062      // Print out the created POJO in JSON format.
063      System.out.println(flat);
064
065      PojoComplex parse = jsonParser.parse(flat, PojoComplex.class);
066
067      assert parse.getId().equals(pojoc.getId());
068      assert parse.getInnerPojo().getName().equals(pojoc.getInnerPojo().getName());
069      assert parse.getInnerPojo().getId().equals(pojoc.getInnerPojo().getId());
070
071      // The object above can be parsed thanks to the @Beanc(properties = id,name) annotation on Pojo
072      // Using this approach, you can keep your POJOs immutable, and still serialize and deserialize them.
073   }
074}
